title: Snapchat shares tumble as Facebook announces a suspiciously similar app
text:
Shares in Snapchat fell by as much as 7pc on Thursday after Facebook announced the release of a new copycat app with almost identical features.

The new app, called Threads, is an offshoot of Instagram that lets users send photos, videos and messages with their "close friends", including disappearing messages.

The app will function as a dedicated inbox for users' closest circle of Instagram contacts, bearing an uncanny resemblance to Snapchat's private messaging screen.

Facebook even boasted that Threads "opens directly to the camera", something Snapchat's chief executive Evan Spiegel has repeatedly emphasised in conference calls with investors.

"Threads offers a new, dedicated home for your favorite conversations," wrote Robby Stein' Instagram's director of product, in a company blog post. "[It] is a standalone app designed with privacy, speed and your close connections in mind.
description: Shares in Snapchat fell by as much as 7pc on Thursday after Facebook announced the release of a new copycat app with almost identical features.
